Paraíso is located along the Gulf Coast shoreline in
.  It offers excellent dining opportunities right on the shore as well as beaches with views of nearby oil platforms ("rigs"), as well as a central plaza fronted by a picturesque church.

Paraíso is readily accessible by local and long-distance buses.  In fact, the overnight bus from Merida to some cities in Tabasco makes a stop in Paraíso at approximately 6 am.

Numerous colectivos ply the route from Comalcalco (home to the largest archaeological site in Tabasco) to Paraíso.  One spot they gather is on the road in front of the Chedraui / Cinepolis Plaza parking lot.

A taxi ride from there is also cheap.

value: The picturesque (although some would say tacky) Templo de San Marcos overlooking Parque Venustiano Carranza.
